main_definition: Sight refers to the ability to see, a visual perception or an instance of something being seen.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of seeing or viewing something with one's eyes
meanings_and_examples.example: The breathtaking sight of Niagara Falls left visitors in awe.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A natural scenery or landscape worth observing and admiring
meanings_and_examples.example: We went on a trip to see the majestic mountains as a wonderful sight.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An opportunity, event, or experience that is seen as remarkable or noteworthy
meanings_and_examples.example: The inauguration of the new president was a significant historical sight.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who can see well, someone with good eyesight
meanings_and_examples.example: My grandfather had excellent sight and could read even fine print without glasses.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The legal right to witness a particular event or process
meanings_and_examples.example: I have the sight of attending every trial because I am a journalist.
